judul.teks1: The VLTÂ® Sine-Wave Filter MCC 101 is an output filter installed between the drive and the motor to create a near-sinusoidal phase-to-phase voltage. It helps reduce voltage spikes, bearing currents, and motor noise, ensuring smoother and longer motor operation.
judul.list3: Converts drive output into a pure sine-wave Reduces motor insulation stress and bearing currents Allows side-by-side installation with the drive for higher ratings
judul.list4: âš™ï¸ High-voltage motors ğŸ”Œ Long cable runs ğŸ­ Industrial applications requiring high reliability

judul.teks1: The VLTÂ® dU/dt Filter MCC 102 is a low-pass filter that reduces the rate of voltage change (dU/dt) at the motor terminals. It is ideal for installations with long motor cables or harsh environments, protecting motors from voltage peaks and insulation wear.
judul.list2: 3 Ã— 200â€“690 V, up to ~880 A (depending on variant)
judul.list3: Reduces voltage spikes and motor insulation stress Low reactance, suitable for dynamic applications and vector control Extends motor lifetime and minimizes electrical interference
judul.list4: ğŸ”Œ Long cable motor runs âš™ï¸ Frequent start/stop systems ğŸ—ï¸ Heavy-duty industrial setups

judul.teks1: The VLTÂ® Brake Resistor MCE 101 absorbs regenerative energy generated during motor deceleration or braking. It protects electrical components from overheating and ensures safe and stable braking performance.
judul.list2: Matched to drive size â€” compatible with all VLTÂ® FC Series drives
judul.list3: Designed specifically for VLTÂ® FC drives Available in horizontal and vertical mounting options Rugged construction with efficient heat dissipation
judul.list4: ğŸ—ï¸ Elevators ğŸšš Conveyors âš™ï¸ Applications with frequent braking ğŸ§± Drive braking systems

judul.teks1: The VLTÂ® Common Mode Filter MCC 105 uses nanocrystalline magnetic cores to reduce high-frequency common-mode currents. It prevents bearing damage and minimizes electromagnetic interference (EMC) in sensitive systems.
judul.list2: Compatible with all VLTÂ® drive power ranges â€” from 0.18 kW up to 1.4 MW
judul.list3: High-performance nanocrystalline core material Oval-shaped design fits tight retrofit spaces Reduces EMI and improves overall system reliability
judul.list4: âš™ï¸ EMC-sensitive installations ğŸ§° Motors with bearing current issues ğŸ­ Precision industrial systems

judul.teks1: The VLTÂ® Line Reactor MCC 103 is an input-side reactor used to reduce harmonics and inrush currents in drive systems. It improves power quality and system stability, especially when multiple drives share a DC-link.
judul.list2: Example unit: 380â€“500 V, 32 A (various ratings available)
judul.list3: Reduces harmonic distortion and input current peaks Improves system stability and power balance Supports load sharing between drives
judul.list4: ğŸ­ Multi-drive systems âš¡ DC-link sharing ğŸ”‹ Large industrial installations
